name - unique package name
version - the current version of this package
author
contributors
main - the entry point of our module
dependencies - the dependencies of the module
devDependencies - the dependencies which are needed for development, out testing framework will be stated here for example
optionalDependencies - packages you want to use but can live without
repository
keywords
license
scripts - map with entry points of the package for npm to use, for mapping of npm commands to script commands

steps.name: notes
value: Node is based on evented I/O
When trying to solve a problem that is I/O bound, the limiting factor is reading/writing to relatively slow interfaces
In many cases, there will be a speed difference between two different interfaces
Also, in many cases, there is no real need to read the entire contents in order to start writing it
Lets go back to our fileAsync.js
While this code works, it's a little bulky and buffers up the entire ipsum.txt file into memory for every request before writing the result back to clients
If ipsum.txt is very large, the program could start eating a lot of memory as it serves lots of users concurrently, particularly for users on slow connections
Lucky enough Node has a built in abstraction as a solution for this use case - Streams
